responses.NoMacroPermission: You are not allowed to use JavaScript macros.
responses.NoRunAsGM: You are not authorized to run this macro as the GM.
responses.SyntaxError: There was an error in your chat message syntax.
responses.MacroSyntaxError: There was an error in your macro syntax. See the console (F12) for details.
responses.ExternalMacroSyntaxError: There was an error in your macro syntax. See the console (F12) of the GM {GM} for details.
responses.TimeoutGM: Timed out waiting to elect a GM to execute the macro.
responses.TimeoutWaitGM: Timed out waiting for the GM to execute the macro.
responses.NoConnectedGM: There are no connected GMs to run the macro {macro} in the GM context.

MACROS.runAsGMTooltip:
This will cause the macro to be executed by the GM when players execute it.
For security reasons, only applies to GM-created macros with no other owners.
MACROS.runForEveryoneTooltip:
This will cause the macro to be executed by the GM for every players connected.
For security reasons, only applies to GM-created macros with no other owners.
MACROS.runForSpecificUserTooltip:
This will cause the macro to be executed by the GM for a specific player connected.
For security reasons, only applies to GM-created macros with no other owners.

highlight.name: Highlight Macro Codes
highlight.hint: If enabled, macro codes will be highlighted. Note that this might be incompatible with other code editor modules.

disableDropHotbarRollTableBehavior.name: Disable Drop On Hotbar RollTable Behavior
disableDropHotbarRollTableBehavior.hint: By default is disabled. The function of creating a macro on the hotbar when dropping a document of type "Rolltable" may cause collision with other modules . This functionality can be disabled with this setting.

setting.reset.name: Reset settings to default
setting.reset.label: Reset Settings To Default
setting.reset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
setting.debug.name: Enable debugging
setting.debug.label: Prints debug messages to the console

dialogs.resetsettings.title: Reset Module Settings
dialogs.resetsettings.content: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
